Quote: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us
Author: Gandalf the Grey

Quote: I would never want to be a member of a group whose symbol was a guy nailed to two pieces of wood
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Have no fear of perfection, you will never reach it
Author: Salvador Dali

Quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants
Author: Epictetus

Quote: We live in a society exquisitely dependent on science and technology in which hardly anyone knows anything about science and technology
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Absence of evidence is not evidence of absence
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Never leave that till tomorrow which you can do today
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quote: SOL and JWF â€” Shit out of luck, and jolly well fucked
Author: George Carlin

Quote: True courage is about being honest with yourself
Author: Mr Robot

Quote: Dwelling is so inefficient
Author: White Rose

Quote: When we lose our principles, we invite chaos
Author: Mr Robot

Quote: Never appeal to a mans better nature, he may not have one
Author: Mr Robot

Quote: I'm afraid your only move here, accept that you've been conned
Author: Philip Price

Quote: A civilization which leaves so large a number of its participants unsatisfied and drives them into revolt neither has nor deserves the prospect of a lasting existence
Author: Sigmund Freud

Quote: Give a man a gun and he can rob a bank, but give a man a bank, and he can rob the world
Author: Tyrell Wellick

Quote: Politics is for puppets
Author: Philip Price

Quote: It is far better to grasp the universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: The immense distances to the stars and the galaxies mean that we see everything in space in the past, some as they were before the Earth came to be. Telescopes are time machines
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Think of the rivers of blood spilled by all those generals and emperors so that in glory and in triumph they could become the momentary masters of a fraction of a dot
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac
Author: George Carlin

Quote: The very existence of flame-throwers proves that some time, somewhere, someone said to themselves, You know, I want to set those people over there on fire, but I'm just not close enough to get the job done
Author: George Carlin

Quote: Do not mistake my generosity, for generosity
Author: White Rose

Quote: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it we go nowhere
Author: Carl Sagan

Quote: Have I just surrounded myself with sycophants who tell me what I want to hear, regardless of the truth
Author: Gavin Benson

Quote: Arguing that you don't care about the right to privacy because you have nothing to hide is no different than saying you don't care about free speech because you have nothing to say
Author: Edward Snowden

Quote: One day there will be no borders, no boundaries, no flags and no countries and the only passport will be the heart
Author: Carlos Santana

Quote: Which of my important nothings shall I tell you first
Author: Jane Austen

Quote: Come the fuck in, or fuck the fuck off
Author: Malcolm Tucker

Quote: Pride should be reserved for something you achieve or obtain on your own, not something that happens by accident of birth
Author: George Carlin

Quote: In the land of the blind, the one-eyed man is King
Author: Proverb

Quote: Build a man a fire, and he'll be warm for a day. Set a man on fire, and he'll be warm for the rest of his life
Author: Terry Pratchett

Quote: All sunshine and no rain makes a desert
Author: Proverb

Quote: Busy people are happy people
Author: Gyles Brandreth

Quote: Consider again that dot. That's here. That's home. That's us. On it everyone you love, everyone you know, everyone you ever heard of, every human being who ever was, lived out their lives. The aggregate of our joy and suffering, thousands of confident religions, ideologies, and economic doctrines, every hunter and forager, every hero and coward, every creator and destroyer of civilization, every king and peasant, every young couple in love, every mother and father, hopeful child, inventor and explorer, every teacher of morals, every corrupt politician, every superstar, every supreme leader, every saint and sinner in the history of our species lived there - on a mote of dust suspended in a sunbeam
Author: Carl Sagan
